page.title: 01Hartley Witney and Elvetham
page.content: Hartley Wintney has grown up where the A30 comes over the south western edge of the Bagshot sands at Blackbushe and crosses the Fleet Rading Rd. north & east, the area rises over 300' in poor heath and conifer plantations, the and then falls rapidly to under 200' where the Hart river flows north west eventually to te Thames. South west the land is mainly hedged in to medium sized fields for mixed farming by Elevethan Estate and independent farmers. The population of about 4800 is concentrated into south west corner around a large village green with its ranks of centuries old oaks, the shops and the road junctions. Apart from village services, there is some local employment in new, small hi tech industries, but a large proportion commute to London, Basingstoke
